messages.subject: need for speed
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/16/02 8:45:43 AM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/16/02 8:45:43 AM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Ethan is just 11.. Thats another factor in my feeling that he is not
"ready"
for a go cart. . He has the NEED FOR SPEED >>

But he feels ready, so couldn't there be compromise?
I would explain my concerns to my child and ask them how they could help me
feel more comfortable with a potentially dangerous vehicle.
I would find a go kart track, or somewhere he could have access without you
investing a fortune. Maybe even ask at a local track if he could hang out
with someone and learn about how it all operates....you never know where a
mentor could be found.
There are options always. It doesn't have to be all or nothing.

Ren
"Knowledge will not always take the place of simple observation."
~Arnold Lobel
Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
